title: Qute: Parse error in template if there is dot in tag name
body:
### Describe the bug

We want to name the tag "chip.tag"
portal-application/src/main/resources/templates/tags/chip.tag.html

`
{#chip.tag}
                    {myContent}
                {/chip.tag}
`

According to the docs it must work because of requirements only to start name https://quarkus.io/guides/qute-reference#identifiers

### Expected behavior

Should be rendered correct

### Actual behavior

Got error "no section helper found"
![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/40321004/5d2a253b-6206-47c2-8f6d-5d6347a35222)

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.2.8.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

For We want to name the tag "chip"
portal-application/src/main/resources/templates/tags/chip.html
all work correct
